column5: thiking about maybe heading out to the pier today. dont have the truck so i can't tow the boat...  yay, or nay?
Better leave now, there might still be an open spot

You can catch SMBass, Walleye, Sheephead (Fresh Water Drum) and Channel Cats there. I have also caught Carp, Pike and Gar it the same area. There is the pier itself, and there is also a riverside park where you can fish. From the pier you can fish either the Lake Erie side, or fish in the Grand River mouth.
Ya never know unless you go!  ... take the camera!
i work this morning til like 8 30, i'm at wrk now actually..  so maybe i'll pack her up and head out there...  if there is no room on the pier, i'll make room
Bring lots of bait. Hook robbers, and gobies,  aplenty.
Marshmallows!!!... don't forget the marshmallows!!!   Snagged Salmoon!!!.... mmmmmmmmmmmm!

Yep, like was said, you have a chance of catching about anything there. This time of year just be happy to hook onto anything at Pt. Maitland.  About 3 weeks ago we had great luck in the lake fishing for smallies from the boat, first one caught was over 20". Last week I tried again but nothing and didn't see too many people fishing from the pier or at the adjoining park.  One of these days I gotta get my pictures downloaded so I can post.  Just so lazy lately.

it's just one of those spots....one day fishing will be on fire...the next nothing...The Grand changes all the time, tough body of water to crack, fish move around alot pending sediment,oxygen levels and such..but if you put the time into it, you will be rewarded.
Well then, get your tail under sail!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!
They started biting 10 minutes after you left... if you leave right now...
Sheesh dude if you're gonna travel that far come out my way and catch something
